and it wasn't the casee that we weren't

what if we were updating that change log

much different like and we didn't have

tell people about it so that was kind of
the problem that sort of stuck with me
and so I'm like well
can we like can we solve this like how
do I make sure that Brian in the future
like never gets gets owned by like a
change log related problem in the future
and that's really kind of where all the
AI stuff came in and that was sort of
the switch for us because the idea
before that was like one of the problems
with writing chain logs is that it's
like it's very unique work like you need
to be like technical enough to
understand the changes you need to
understand the customers you need to be
able to understand what the you know
product team you know there's like a

then you need to have enough like sales

like here's why we did it here's why
your company should pay us more money or
you know like here's the business
benefit to to making this change um and
everybody is super busy um so the the
idea sort of before we got to what we've
landed on right now was like well we
could kind of centralize all this
information in one place like right now
there's like conversation happening in
GitHub there's conversations happening
in linear or whatever PM tool you're
using there's like slack conversations
and then there's actually like code
being written there's like pool requests
and like diffs like actual like lines of
code changing so that was kind of our
first idea of like maybe we can like
centralize all these things in one place
so that a human could possibly do it not
that they not that they will be able to
be successful but like it's just like
literally impossible task if you don't
have that information in front of you
and so then AI comes along and you know
they they kind of like you get the a
idea of like what if what if the change
log just writes itself like what if we
could train an engine that you know the
the first version I kind of make the
joke that we're on like update engine
six right now the first version we're
like hey what if we just like ship a

aai and say RAR updates um and that

and you know we've gone through tons and
tons and tons of changes where it's like
oh well you just like I think that's one
of the cool things about the AI

apparent where the gaps are it's like oh
like this update's just like doesn't
have enough information it's okay cool
we need to bring in more context and
then it's like oh like this was
technically correct but it doesn't
understand who our customers are it's
like okay cool we need to like load in
context about the business and then like
oh this update is correct for the
customers and correct for what the
change is but it doesn't understand the
history of the product so okay we need
to build in kind of that you know so we
kind of it's like pipelines on top of

have like I'd say the update engine's

I I remember it was like earlier this

I'm like oh this is like I would share

sorry it was a little bit little bit of
a little bit of a ramble exciting

getting to a product where you know
we're we're still in the phase of like I
I want to get to the point where this is

like okay well what if we just build

we're in the stage of the hype cycle
